page.title: 01REVIEW OF TYWARDREATH AREA
page.content: Our area can be split into three sections: the village of{Tywardreath} itself, outlying scattered {farms}and small groups of{housing}at Castle Dore, Treesmill, Kilhallon and St. Winnow. The name Tywardreath means{"House on {the Sand"}and the sea did once come as far as the village.{Daphne du Maurier} who lives near by used characters and places from the area as part of her book,"House on the Strand". The village itself is situated on top of a hill overlooking St. Austell Bay and has the mild,soft climate associated with the south coast of Cornwall. Although not in our area, it is impossible to talk about the region without mentioning the {China Clay works around St. Austell and the Clay Docks at the neighbouring village of Par.
